results.title: Writing: the new. Part 3
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: The new general writing section of HSC English distinguishes between argumentative and imaginative writing tasks and creatice writing. This program explores comments on these tasks and provides some guidence for their management. Presented by Peter Couchman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Country Education Project

results.title: Writing: making meaning
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Looks at the process of teaching children to write in the postprimary school by focusing on teaching methods of three teachers. Stresses that writing for meaning comes first and mechanics of writing second. Narrated by Diane O’Connor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Writing, plain and fancy
results.creator_credit: Severo Perez, Mallory Pearce and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Surveys the evolution of written communication. Beginning with the Romans and their invention of capital letters, the program continues through the reign of the great King Charlemagne who standardized the alphabet. The importance of legible writing for good communication is stressed. Narrated by John Houseman.

results.title: Writing for real
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary about the way in which a group of Year 10 students work with a local facility for elderly people to develop their understanding of the workplace, exploring their relationships between people and the workplace and apply school-based learning to a practical suggestion.

results.title: Writing better business letters
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Emphasizes the three principle characteristics of a good business letter - clarity, brevity, and courtesy. States the simple principle of letter writing, how to write letters easily and naturally.

results.title: Writers' block
results.brief_description: Writer’s block was developed as a character-driven interactive that gives the user the opportunity to view characters involved in the creative process of writing; including having trouble with muses and getting distracted by too many coffee breaks. The CDROM also contains practical information for would be authors ranging from getting started as a writer through to organising a poetry reading.

results.title: Write Your Own Ticket
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Seven Dimensions and Eve Ash
results.brief_description: Ron Barassi outlines a strategy for setting and achieving goals that relate to career plans, study, ambitions, sports, work and fitness. Decide on future directions; list goals and their purpose; and determine schedule and personal cost.

results.title: Wrestling fundamentals
results.creator_credit: D Richardson and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: The film illustrates the moves and countermoves required in good amateur wrestling. Illustrates rules, takedowns, pinholds and the techniques of chain wrestling.
